TypeSignature.Value: .class nested protected auto ansi beforefieldinit DataGridViewCell/DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject extends System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject

Docs.summary: Provides information about a to accessibility client applications.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Windows Forms includes built-in accessibility support that allows your application to work with accessibility client applications. Examples of accessibility client applications include screen enlarger and reviewer utilities, voice input utilities, on-screen keyboards, alternative input devices, and keyboard enhancement utilities.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject> class inherits from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject> class to provide information about a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell> to accessibility client applications. Each class that represents a visual part of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> - such as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell> - also contains a class that inherits from <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject> to provide information about the containing class and perform actions on behalf of accessibility client applications.
There are instances when you will want to provide additional information, such as the name or description of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> control, to accessibility client applications. There are two ways of providing this additional information. To provide limited accessibility information for existing controls, set the control's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.AccessibleName%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.AccessibleDescription%2A> property values, which will be reported to accessibility client applications.
> [!NOTE] > You should change the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.AccessibleDefaultActionDescription%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.AccessibleRole%2A> property values only in rare situations, such as if you make a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> look like a list.
Occasionally, you might require more accessibility information or different accessibility actions to be included with your custom <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell>. To customize accessibility, you can write your own class that derives from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataGridViewAccessibleObject> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject> classes and override the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.CreateAccessibilityInstance%2A> method. For example, if you are writing a custom row header cell that implements unique custom actions, such as special hit testing within your cell, you should create a class that inherits from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell.DataGridViewRowHeaderCellAccessibleObject> class and override the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell.CreateAccessibilityInstance%2A> method.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> exposes its data structure by using <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole> values to define the data table hierarchy. For more information on exposing data tables to Microsoft Active Accessibility, see "Exposing Data Tables through Microsoft Active Accessibility" in the MSDN library at http://msdn.microsoft.com/library.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void DoDefaultAction() cil managed

Docs.summary: Performs the default action associated with the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the cell associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject> is a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell>, this method does nothing. Otherwise, this method selects the cell, makes it the current cell, and takes one of the following actions:
- If the cell's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.ReadOnly%2A> property value is `true`, this method returns.
- If the cell's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.EditType%2A> property value is `null`, meaning the cell cannot host an editing control, this method returns.
- If the cell is currently entering or leaving edit mode (for example, if this method is called in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellBeginEdit> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellEndEdit> event handler), this method returns.
- If the cell is currently in edit mode, this method commits and ends the edit.
- If the cell is not in edit mode and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.EditMode%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewEditMode.EditProgrammatically>, this method returns.
- If none of the preceding actions is taken, this method causes the cell to enter edit mode.

Public Overrides Function Navigate (navigationDirection As AccessibleNavigation) As AccessibleObject

Docs.summary: Navigates to another accessible object.
Docs.returns: A that represents the at the specified value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following table describes which <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell> owns the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject> that is returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Navigate%2A> method for each parameter value.
|Parameter value|Description| |---------------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleNavigation.Right>|The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell> to the right of the current cell. <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Navigate%2A> returns `null` if the current cell is in the right-most column.| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleNavigation.Left>|The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell> to the left of the current cell. <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Navigate%2A> returns an accessible object for the row header if the current cell is in the left-most column.| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleNavigation.Next>|The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell> that has the next higher index. <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Navigate%2A> returns `null` if the current cell is in the first column.| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleNavigation.Previous>|The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell> that has the next lower index. <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Navigate%2A> returns `null` if the current cell is in the last column.| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleNavigation.Up>|The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell> in the same column and one row above the current cell. <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Navigate%2A> returns `null` if the current cell is in the first row.| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleNavigation.Down>|The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell> in the same column and one row below the current cell. <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Navigate%2A> returns `null` if the current cell is in the last row.| |All other <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleNavigation> values|`null`.|

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following table describes the action performed by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Select%2A> method for each `flags` value.
|Parameter value|Action| |---------------------|------------| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleSelection.TakeFocus>|The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> takes focus.| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleSelection.TakeSelection>|The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell> that owns this <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject> takes focus.| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleSelection.AddSelection>|The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell> is added to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.SelectedCells%2A> property.| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleSelection.RemoveSelection>|The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell> is removed from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.SelectedCells%2A> property.| |All other <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleSelection> values|No action is taken.|

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property State As AccessibleStates
public: virtual property System::Windows::Forms::AccessibleStates State { System::Windows::Forms::AccessibleStates get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the state of the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The return value always includes the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates.Selectable> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates.Focusable> values. It also includes the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates.Selected> value if the associated cell is selected, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates.Focused> value if the cell has keyboard focus, and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates.Offscreen> value if the cell is not currently displayed.

Public Overrides Property Value As String
public: virtual property System::String ^ Value { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Value : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a string representing the formatted value of the owning cell.
Docs.value: A representation of the cell value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Value%2A> property contains a string that represents the value of the cell <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.FormattedValue%2A> property. If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.FormattedValue%2A> is `null`, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Value%2A> contains the string "(null)".
Setting this property has no effect if the owning cell is a header cell, is read-only, or does not belong to a row. Otherwise, setting this property:
- Ends any edit currently in progress and commits the value.
- Uses the cell <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.GetFormattedValue%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.ParseFormattedValue%2A> methods to convert the specified value to the type indicated by the cell <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.ValueType%2A> property.
- Sets the cell value to the converted value.

Docs.exception: The value of the property is .
